intro: Anastrabe integerrima, commonly known as the rigid anastrabe, is a rare and unusual plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic study.
